intro: Syringa emodi var. villosissima, commonly known as the Himalayan lilac, is a deciduous shrub native to the mountainous regions of the Himalayas. It is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and clusters of fragrant, pale lilac flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant has a compact growth habit and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. It prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, thriving in cooler climates. Its hairy stems and leaves, which give it the species name *villosissima*, are distinctive features that aid in its identification.
